list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Our methods are swift and efficient

list_definition.definition: a type of bird rather like a swallow.

list_ex_of_english: Many swifts have long swept-back wings that resemble a crescent or a boomerang.
A bilateral readjustment was swift and fundamentally unanimous.
The legendary hellbender inhabits the range's swifter streams.
Determined adherence to socialist rhetoric made liberalisation at the end of the decade unexpectedly swift.
They each do a series of sets, consisting of five quadrilles played at successively swifter tempos.
In the century that followed the movement of goods and people was accelerated by increasingly swifter forms of transportation.
The resemblances between the swallows and swifts are due to convergent evolution reflecting similar life styles.
However, most swifts are more complicated than this.
